1_1ASQXi7waaCUePWHbbsM2LSPVZ8dHGm7LQ.body: A reminder of how important signing is in package managers.

> [nofish](#comment_462_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It was signed: "The KeRanger application was signed with a valid Mac app development certificate"

Right, the distribution channel was totally compromized. All I'm saying is that a major package manager with proper security practices is much less likely to get compromized then basically a random website on the Internet.

1_1LJMypJ67iEBwah82xwVVdB8SGZ1mwqgHQ.body:
If you run zeronet with '--tor always' then it should only connect via tor.
On Linux, you can check incoming and outgoing connections and listening ports using 'lsof -i -n -P', look for python2 for zeronet, it should only listen on local interface and all connections should be to localhost (127.0.0.1), which is how Tor connections appear.
On Windows... good luck with toy operating systems ;)
